html:
3.28.17  11:17 am   I saw your response to that guy on 1.18.17 11:02 pm asking about the real book chords. not having much keyboard experience i thought your idea of just playing all the songs was amazing and i gave it a shot. after playing about 30 of them i have a few questions 1. #9 chords are kind of bothering me. am i supposed to play with the minor second clash right next to each other or spread it out, because it sounds better spread out but a lot of times i can't get to that position fast enough.

2. same for 11s and 13s whats a good way to voice them?

3. i've just been doing block chords so far and that has been challenging enough. How do I play these charts in a more realistic groove (you mentioned bossa nova and I have no idea what that is)

4. what kind of situations do I leave out the fifth? I realized that I specifically always include it but i've heard from other places that its kind of an optional note

thanks! already i've been realizing stuff and its amazing
original_html:
3.28.17  11:17 am   I saw your response to that guy on 1.18.17 11:02 pm asking about the real book chords. not having much keyboard experience i thought your idea of just playing all the songs was amazing and i gave it a shot. after playing about 30 of them i have a few questions 1. #9 chords are kind of bothering me. am i supposed to play with the minor second clash right next to each other or spread it out, because it sounds better spread out but a lot of times i can't get to that position fast enough.

2. same for 11s and 13s whats a good way to voice them?
